panels.title: Number of Consul Clients (No data in agentless mode)

panels.description: Use consul.raft.rpc.appendEntries to understand how long it takes a follower node to process newly received Raft logs from the leader. Like consul.raft.commitTime, increases in this metric can indicate higher load on your Consul servers, and come with a risk of stale data. Since this metric is exposed within each follower, you should aggregate it as both an average (to track overall load on your Raft servers) and a percentile (to watch for outlier nodes).
panels.title: Follower Append Entries Latency 99th and 50th (ms)
Average Raft FSM Apply Latency per 5 minutes (ms)

panels.description: An approximate measurement of the proportion of time the main Raft goroutine is busy and unavailable to accept new work.
panels.title: Raft thread main saturation (percentage)

panels.description: An approximate measurement of the proportion of time the FSM Raft goroutine is busy and unavailable to accept new work.
panels.title: Raft thread FSM saturation (percentage)

panels.description: Measures the time spent updating the raft store from the serf member information.
panels.title: Average latency of leader reconcile per 5 minutes (ms)

panels.description: Increments whenever a Consul server becomes a leader.
panels.title: Count of a new leader elected [so far] (increasing only)

panels.description: Increments whenever a Consul agent in client mode makes an RPC request to a Consul server
panels.title: Rate of RPC requests per 5 minutes - client side

panels.description: Increments when a server accepts an RPC connection.
panels.title: RPC Accept Connection Count Rate per 5 minutes - server side

panels.description: Increments whenever a Consul agent in client mode makes an RPC request to a Consul server and fails.
panels.title: Rate of Failed RPC requests per 5 minutes - client side

panels.description: Increments when a server receives a Consul-related RPC request.
panels.title: Rate of RPC requests per 5 minutes - server side

panels.description: Increments whenever a Consul agent in client mode makes an RPC request to a Consul server gets rate limited by that agent's limits configuration.
panels.title: Rate of Exceeded RPC requests per 5 minutes - client side

panels.description: Increments when a server returns an error from an RPC request.
panels.title: Error rate of RPC requests per 5 minutes - server side
